data.title: Scarface: The World Is Yours
data.text:
Configure settings.ini

After installing the mod the next time we open the game a file called “settings.ini” is generated in which we can configure many things manually.

These are all the commands that we can use in the .ini, to use them we have to write them manually

ScreenWidth= ; Width of the window ScreenHeight= ; Height of the window MSAA=8 ; Anti-aliasing (8 is max) DrawDistance=2 ; 0 to 2 (Far) EnableSFX=1 ; Enable special FX (Sun, lens flare, etc... Aniso=16 ; Anisotropic Filtering (16 is max) Trilinear=0 ; Trilinear filtering Brightness=5 ; Adjust game brightness (10 is max) Mouse=10 ; Mouse speed

Additional Patch options: LanguageID= ; E (English, Czech, German, Polish, Russian) ; F (France) -> Requires specific game files for functionality ; I (Italian) -> Requires specific game files for functionality ; S (Spanish) -> Requires specific game files for functionality These files can be found in the translation mods made for the remastered project in the optional mod files. SPANISH TRANSLATION FRENCH TRANSLATION ITALIAN TRANSLATION Vibrance=50 ; Adjustable vibrance (0 - 100) (50 -> Default) ShowFPS=0 ; Shows FPS at left corner. SkipLicenseScreen=0 ; Skips license screen while starting up game. SkipMovies=0 ; Skips intro movies while starting up game. WidescreenHUD=1 ; Modifies 4:3 HUD to 16:9 Ratio.

[Bind] WallCover=H ; Changed to 'H', game's default is 'Enter' Walk=ALT

[Windowed] Mode=0 ; 0: None, 1: Windowed, 2: Windowed Borderless

[ParticleEmitter] EmissionRate=2 ; 0: Disabled, 1: Quality, 2: Balanced, 3: Performance, 4: Potato

[PostProcessFX] Enable=0 ; Enables blur & bloom. Bloom=50 ; The game uses dynamic value, using this option will force the value to be always same

[Patch] EnableMemoryAllocator=0 ; 0: Use system's default malloc/free, 1: Use Doug Lea Memory Allocator DebugMenu=0 ; Shows debug option in the pause menu.
